title._content: Catalogue of Books, Deseronto Public Library (1896), pp.54-55

description._content:
Pages 54 and 55 of the 1896 catalogue of books in Deseronto Public Library, Deseronto, Ontario, with an advertisement on p.54 for the "A.O.U.W. Quinte Lodge, No. 215, Deseronto
Officers for Year 1895
R. Massie, M.W.
W. W. Foster, F.M.W.
R. Bogart, Foreman
A. Snider, Overseer
Geo. Field, Recorder
S. H. Miller, Financier
A. P. Brown, Receiver
E. T. Davey, Guide
J. Chapman, I.W.
W. B. Graham, O.W.
The Society relieves the suffering, cares for the sick, buries the dead, and bequeaths to the widow and children of deceased members (in good standing) the sum of $2,000.
Lodge meets First and Third Friday evening in each month in Foresters' Hall. 
Visiting brethren welcome."

On p.55 is an advertisement for "D. W. Dart, manufacturer and dealer in Fine Furniture and Undertaking...our warerooms are the largest and most complete to be found in Eastern Ontario.
The celebrated Karn Pianos & Organs, of which I carry the largest and finest display ever seen in Deseronto. I invite competition. Old Pianos and Organs taken in exchange.
Special attention will be paid to our Undertaking Department."
